report_title: Covid-19 Update: Acne Treatment Manufacturing OTC Industry
executive_summary: The Acne Treatment Manufacturing OTC industry benefits from fairly stable demand because acne-prone individuals consider them a necessary expense. However, adolescents comprise the industry's largest market. High unemployment levels and low disposable incomes within this shrinking age bracket have caused sales of over-the-counter (OTC) acne treatments to drop. Moreover, the industry has been undercut by less expensive goods produced abroad. Increasingly, manufacturers have sought to locate internationally to take advantage of lower labor costs, causing imports to expand as a share of domestic demand. So, industry-wide revenue has been decreasing at a CAGR of 1.2% over the past five years, including an estimated 1.1% increase in 2023, and is expected to total $413.6 million in 2023. Further, profit is projected to decrease to 19.9% in 2023.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: OTC acne manufacturers are battling to stay competitive
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Demand for OTC acne products is fairly resilient to economic conditions; however, the industry has struggled with a declining number of adolescents and low disposable incomes in this age group. To remain more competitive, domestic manufacturers have increasingly shifted production abroad. Manufacturers have sought to locate internationally to take advantage of lower labor costs, causing imports to expand as a share of domestic demand.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Manufacturers are developing new products designed to target older demographics
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: According to 2020 data from Medscape Reference, 12.0% of women and 5.0% of men at age 25 have acne; by age 45, 5.0% of men and women still have acne. The rising prevalence of adult-onset and persistent acne conditions has resulted in more customizable products that appeal to consumers with higher disposable incomes.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The industry faces external competition on several fronts
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Prescription treatments, laser and light therapy are the most common substitute for OTC acne products. Prescription treatments usually come from vitamin A, benzoyl peroxide and antibiotics.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry is in the mature stage of its life cycle. Still, it will continue to experience new product introductions, particularly OTC acne treatments made from all-natural and organic ingredients. Adolescents will remain the industry's core target market; however, the prevalence of adult-onset acne, particularly among women, will continue increasing. Consequently, manufacturers will introduce new products for this demographic, expanding their customer base.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Manufacturers Will Contend With an Increasingly Globalized Market
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The value of imports will expand as internationally produced brand names and generic acne prescriptions become more widely used. The trade-weighted index (TWI) will drop, making US products relatively more affordable to international buyers. Rising e-commerce and social media platforms will prevent sudden decreases in exports.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Industry Will Benefit and Suffer as the Economy Recovers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As per capita disposable income recovers, consumers will be able to afford more expensive prescriptions and laser treatments, heightening competition for the industry. Improving economic conditions will also help bolster consumer spending on OTC acne products. Consumers will shift their spending slightly toward higher-cost OTC acne products and kits as cost considerations become less pressing for households.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Marketing and R&D Will Likely Remain Critical to Maintaining a Market Presence
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Digital marketing will persist, emphasizing corporate social responsibility and incorporating sustainable practices. Manufacturers will continue investing in research and development to formulate new and innovative OTC acne products.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures over-the-counter (i.e., nonprescription) acne treatment and medication. Manufacturers include active ingredients like benzoyl peroxide, salicylic acid, sulfur, resorcinol or a combination of such ingredients and a range of inactive ingredients like emollients and surfactants. OTC acne treatments are mostly topical and are manufactured as gels, moisturizers, lotions, creams, soaps and pads.

opportunities: High Revenue Growth (2023-2028): Per capita disposable income
threats: Low Revenue Growth (2018-2023): Low Outlier Growth, Low Performance Drivers, Number of adolescents aged 10 to 19

key_trends: The industry has benefited from decreased demand for more expensive prescription products
In addition to intense competition from leading brand names, the value of imports has declined
Various alternative treatments for acne have emerged, including laser and light therapy
Improving economic conditions is expected to help bolster consumer spending on acne remedies
The industry is expected to contend with an increasingly globalized market

market_segmentation.segment_description: Warehouse clubs offer customers a wide selection of goods, often in bulk, at discounted prices, in exchange for a membership fee paid by each customer. Supercenters are large discount department stores that also sell perishable groceries.
Drug stores sell a range of prescription and OTC medications, health and beauty items, toiletries and consumable goods directly to consumers.
End consumers comprise the industry's third-largest market; they purchase anti-acne products directly from manufacturers through online catalogs and phone sales.
This market purchased fewer acne treatments manufactured by OTC acne companies to stock their inventory.

products_and_services.product_description: Manufacturers commonly produce facial cleansers in liquid, gel, cream or foam forms.
The segment includes oil-free acne moisturizer, clear pore oil-eliminating moisturizer and other items that prevent irritation, peeling and dryness.
Manufacturers commonly produce body care in gel or liquid, helping prevent breakouts on the back, chest and shoulder areas without over-drying or irritating skin.
This segment includes acne spot treatments, toners, facial masks, medicated pads and wipes.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: OTC acne treatments benefit from fairly stable demand, as consumers consider OTC acne products to be necessary purchases.

Acne is a common skin problem experienced by teenagers and adolescents; according to the American Academy of Dermatology, more than 40.0% of adolescents have acne or acne scarring that requires treatment by their mid-teens.
There is very little differentiation among OTC acne products in terms of treatment.

international_trade_points.trade_title: U.S. Exports to a Handful of Foreign Markets
international_trade_points.trade_description: The value of OTC acne product exports has decreased, partially because of the appreciation of the US dollar.

international_trade_points.trade_title: U.S.-Based Companies Capitalize on Foreign Consumer Confidence
international_trade_points.trade_description: The industry, being in its mature phase, has sought opportunities abroad to explore new product markets.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Importers Benefit from a Rising US Dollar
international_trade_points.trade_description: An appreciating US dollar has made imported products more affordable domestically.

international_trade_points.trade_title: The Exception Tariff on Pharmaceutical Products Benefits Foreign Manufacturers
international_trade_points.trade_description: Tariff barriers are no longer a form of protection for the Acne Treatment Manufacturing OTC industry following the Uruguay Round of GATT.

business_locations.location_description: The West region has the highest concentration of establishments (around 35%), while its population percentage is relatively lower (around 20%).
New Jersey and New York are the second and third-most popular states for industrial establishments.
This region has significant consumer destinations like Atlanta and Miami, with high population densities.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The FDA regulates the types of active ingredients permitted for topical acne care products.
The FPLA protects against mislabeled products.
OSHA is responsible for the OSHA Hazard Communication Standard.
The EPA is responsible for the protection of human health and the environment.
The AWA regulates the treatment of animals in research, teaching, testing, exhibition, transport and by dealers.
Health and safety guidelines were established in 2020 amid COVID-19.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The FDA is the primary regulating body governing acne treatment manufacturing OTC.
Acne treatment manufacturing OTC requires factory and production equipment, which can be costly.
Building a brand identity is crucial for differentiating products.

basis_points.basis_description: Price is an important basis of competition among manufacturers.
Consumers often buy products based on the manufacturer's reputation.
R&D of new products is growing in importance due to competition.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Aggressive Marketing Strategies Have Contributed to the Boost of Concentration
concentration_points.concentration_description: Larger manufacturers with more resources have spent heavily on advertising.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Manufacturers Place a High Value on Economies of Scale and Research and Development
concentration_points.concentration_description: Manufacturers invest heavily in research and development to keep their products competitive.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Product success depends on research and development (R&D)
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Manufacturers constantly invest in R&D to develop and launch new products.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: For every $1.00 spent on wages in 2023, an estimated $0.19 is spent on machinery.

volatility_points.volatility_description: OTC acne medications are typically considered necessary purchases.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The Industry's Primary Market Consists of Consumers Aged 10 to 19
volatility_points.volatility_description: The number of people aged 10 to 19 has slightly declined.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Acne treatment manufacturing OTC companies invest significantly in R&D.
Industry production involves mixing and blending readily available active and inactive ingredients.

FAQs.question: How is your company affected by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Rising imports from European manufacturers are a source of intense competition for domestic manufacturers.

FAQs.question: How much does your company allocate to marketing expenses?
FAQs.answer: On average, depending on the size of the company, an average company allocates between 1.0 and 5.0% of total revenue on advertising and promotion.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: The price of plastic and resin products, which are a main component of industry product packaging, can increase purchase costs, thereby constraining profitability.
